 wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Hi,
> > > > > 
> > > > > If the warc.gz was gen=
erated using wget, (or possibly any tool
> > other than Heritrix), it may b=
e that the Wayback codebase can't
> > understand it. I hit this with wget d=
ue to a specific issue with GZip
> > fields (see https://github.com/ukwa/wa=
rc-discovery/issues/1 for
> > details). One way around it is to decompress =
and recompress using JWAT
> > Tools (https://sbforge.org/display/JWAT/JWAT-=
Tools).
> > > > > 
> > > > > Note that I have also hit a similar problem wi=
th some compressed
> > WARCs with the very latest 1.8.0-SNAPSHOT version of=
 Wayback, although
> > it's not clear if this is related to the first issue=
 or not. (see
> > https://github.com/ukwa/warc-explorer/issues/5 for detail=
s). Version
> > 1.7.1-SNAPSHOT is currently the most reliable for me.
> > >=
 > > 
> > > > > Thanks,
> > > > > Andy Jackson
> > > > >
